result.execSummary:
The defendant David Scott Albrecht Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Price County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Payment of financial obligations is to occur 30 days from release of custody.  Failure to pay will result in 1 day in jail for each $10 owing.
Consecutive to: to 15CF11, 15CF27 and any other sentence in being.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing on 11-02-15

11:02 am - 15CF11, 15CF27, 15CF7 - Defendant David Scott Albrecht in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Comments by Atty. Lex. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Written explanation of determinate sentence provided. Is eligible for CEP & SAP. Adj. 11:36 am. 
Court imposes:

15CF11 (Ct. 1): 3 1/2 year prison term (18 months initial confinement/24 months extended supervision), cc to 15CF27, cs to any other sentence in being, with credit for 239 days time served
Conditions:
$268 court costs
$250 DNAAS & submit sample
Apology
AODA
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Condition may be relaxed if enrolled and attending form of higher education.
Any other behavioral rehabilitative services as deemed appropriate by agent.

15CF27 (Ct. 1): 3 1/2 year prison term (18 months initial confinement/24 months extended supervision), cc to 15CF11, cs to any other sentence in being
Conditions:
$268 court costs
$65 SBDA
$350 buy money to Phillips PD
AODA
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Condition may be relaxed if enrolled and attending form of higher education.
Any other behavioral rehabilitative services as deemed appropriate by agent.

15CF7 (Ct. 1): 6 month jail term, cs to 15CF11, 15CF27 and any other sentence in being with credit for 1 day time served; $243 court costs - Financial obligations to be paid 30 days from release of custody or CO.
Sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 11:00 am

10:01 am - 15CF7, 15CF11, 15CF27 - Defendant David Scott Albrecht in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Off record at 10:04 am. On record at 10:08 am. DA files information in 15CF27. DA certifies victims rights compliance. DA moves to amend 15CF7 to 940.19(1) Misd. A Battery and moves to amend 15CF11 to 946.49(1)(b) Fel. Bail Jump and amend Ct. 1 in 15CF27 to 961.41(1)(i) delivery of schedule 4 controlled substance deleting enhancer.  Court questions DE regarding right to preliminary hearing and waiver form. Court finds waiver is given freely and accepts waiver. Parties have received, reviewed and waive reading of information. Court orders amendment of charges. DE pleads NO CONTEST 15CF7, 15CF11 & Ct. 1 in 15CF27.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 15CF7, 15CF11 and Ct. 1 in 15CF27 and on motion of DA dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 in 15CF27. Court orders PSI. Adj. 10:23 am.
Plea hearing at 09-02-2015 10:00 am

1:55 pm - DA calls cases 15CF7 and 15CF11 and states appearances. Defendant David Scott Albrecht in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Admissability limited to statements made in police reports.  DA calls Inspector Greg Wirsing called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty Lex.  Court asks questions for clarification.  Redirect by DA.  Re-cross by Lex.  Argument by Atty's.  Court summarizes and makes decision.  Motion to suppress statements denied.
Jury trial at 09-02-2015 09:00 am

Defendant David Scott Albrecht appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.      DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits not waived.  Bond to continue.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Kenneth J. Bogdanovic nor C.S., DOB 01-01-2000.  DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval from Court.
